messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dads' discussion
messages.messageBody:
**
<< Please tape this. I really want to hear but also want the Dads to speak
freely. There side is important to maybe understand my own dh.
>>

I think taping it will keep them from speaking freely and they should be
given their privacy.

Maybe one of them could summarize the good parts for an HEM article!!! **


I agree with Sandra! I bought and old tape of Dad's from the Sacramento
conference and one of my friend's husbands was speaking on it. His
voice was clearly recognizable to me, even though I didn't know he had
been at this long-ago conference. (He did say anything too incriminating.)

Instead of listening to a tape, each woman can "debrief" her husband
after the discussion. Think how much fun that could be if you took it
literally! <g>

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dads' discussion
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/17/03 10:40:29 AM, cottrellbentley@cox.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/17/03 10:40:29 AM, cottrellbentley@... writes:

<< You don't
want to exclude the reluctant Moms from the families with
Pro-Unschooling Dads. >>

Yeah, they might!!

Anyone who's reluctant at a conference will benefit from any and all of it.

Dad's have that dad thing which won't go away whether they're reluctant or
not.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dads' discussion
messages.msgSnippet: ... Maybe something more along the lines of For the kid s caregiver that heard about unschooling through the kid s other caregiver .  You don t want to
messages.messageBody:
> ***You could call the seminar or whatever it is "Just for Dads" that should
> keep the mom's out :-)***
>
> Or call it "No Mom's Allowed"!!

Maybe something more along the lines of "For the kid's caregiver that
heard about unschooling through the kid's other caregiver". You don't
want to exclude the reluctant Moms from the families with
Pro-Unschooling Dads. Not to mention the other caregivers that a child
might have.

-Lisa in AZ, who is still trying to figure out a possible way to get to
this conference

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dads' discussion
messages.msgSnippet: ***You could call the seminar or whatever it is Just for Dads that should keep the mom s out :-)*** Or call it No Mom s Allowed !! Jennifer
messages.messageBody:
***You could call the seminar or whatever it is "Just for Dads" that should
keep the mom's out :-)***

Or call it "No Mom's Allowed"!!

Jennifer

messages.subject: dads' discussion
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra, What a Great idea! Also thanks for changing the subject lline. ;-) What do you think Kelly? I hope there s a dh that will. Barb E Read, every day,
messages.messageBody:
Sandra,
What a Great idea! Also thanks for changing the subject lline. ;-) What
do you think Kelly? I hope there's a dh that will.

Barb E
Read, every day, something that no one else is reading.
Think, every day, something that no one else is thinking.
Do, every day, something no one else would be silly enough to do.
It is bad for the mind to continually be part of unanimity.
~Christopher Morley
